item.title: Understanding Deontology Theory in Healthcare
item.description: Ethical principles and duties in medicine Ethics: Utilitarianism and Deontology Deontology is an ethical theory that uses rules to discern the moral course of action. This video is part of Ethics Defined, Utilitarianism | Ethics Defined W1.1 Theory of Healthcare Ethics Our next stop in our tour of the ethical lay of the land is utilitarianism. Also, the respect for patient Dr. Matthew Shea is a philosophy professor at Franciscan University of Steubenville. Website: How Does Deontology Guide Ethical Analysis?
